I'm lost here. Whats with the link?{{champion:24}}

A scam. Scammers just realized they keep getting downvoted and called out, so they make more than a single account and upvote their own posts, then leave some comments saying it's legit and downvotes all the comments saying it's a scam.

It's really pathetic if you ask me.
Some BS scam
"Free" Riot Points. If it looks too good to be true, it probably is.
yea pretty nice

You think people are retarded enough to not realize scammers needs to make more than a single account and downvotes all the comments saying it's a scam? And upvote the ones saying it's legit?

You guys are pathetic. You make me sick. Why don't you get a real job instead of trying to steal people's hard earned money? You scammers are the cliché of fat fucks in their mom basement fucking a waifu pillow.
I thought I could go 3 minutes without seeing one of these scams, guess not.
Me too :(

The only thing we can enjoy when it comes to talking about Teemo
Teemo nerfs?

General 

KITTY CONSISTENCY :  When Rengar jumps from stealth or the brush, he now lands very slightly short of the target. **_Like 1/16th of a Teemo short._** This will prevent overzealous Rengars who occasionally jump right on top of their target, only to throw their Bola past them.
How long is one _Teemo_ to be exact?
Exactly two half-Teemos.
Teemo is a perfect 100x100 unit box, so it's easy to use him as a reference point
A Teemo is 100 units.

the art crew members were possibly playing ARK, then they raged on a DODO-Rex, and then said "well, lets make skins that kills dodo rex!"
the atmosphere looks more like Monster Hunter IMO
The biggest problem with new champ select is not being able to see the champs you own until it's your turn to pick. Makes it really hard to organize trades with other people.

I was looking through the "New champ select improvements" section to find the line "We made it so you now get your primary role more often than your secondary, since it's clearly your preferred role" or some permutation thereof. I did not find it... Severely disappointed by this. 

The way it's supposed to work is "I want my primary role, but if I have to wait in queue for over 5-6 minutes, I guess I'd be ok with my secondary role". Right now, the client seems to think it means "I'm just as ok with my secondary role as my primary, if not moreso, and if I get my secondary role I'll be just as happy as I would be if I had gotten my primary role." This is incorrect, and needs to be fixed.

I noticed this a lot too so a friend and I tested it. I went jg primary, mid secondary and he did the exact opposite (mid primary, jg secondary) and we both got our secondaries instead of our primaries... rito pls
Except you didn't do that because the game will tell you that you have to cover a broader selection with only 2 people.
we had a five man that had all lanes covered

Well, if that was the case it wouldn't even show you your secondary role because you all have your own primary lol, would be no need to give you a secondary when all 5 of you pick your own different primary.

I always choose support as my secondary, but it's like support is my primary, because I constantly keep getting it, so you got some sense there. Then again, it is support, so I can't really argue, because apparently, support isn't a very popular role to choose. :/
I'm happy as a support main for exactly this reason.

Can this be implemented so that before you select your champion you can click the arrow to bring up the champion list?  

Because I hate how I cant see any of my champions before its my turn to pick.  Thanks!

Hey sorry i'm pretty new. Can someone explain to me the change to rengar's q?
whats the difference between the damage buff and total damage scaling

No worries, we all start somewhere. It's not a damage buff, it's a different way of calculating scaling. They changed it from being 50% total AD to 30% total + 20% bonus. Total is the total amount of AD you have (base + items + other e.g. Janna shield), while bonus is ONLY the extra AD you have on top of your base (items + other). So while before, if rengar had 80 base ad and 120 from items, his 8 would do 100 damage. But now, it would do 84 (60 (30% total) + 24 (20% bonus)).

However, the difference becomes less significant the higher total AD he gets, as the difference of the base AD becomes a smaller percentage. So basically, this is a bigger nerf to his early game, preventing excessive snowballing, while not punishing him too hard if he does get ahead.
